In addition, I have a feeling that Pat Morita - at least by today's standards - gives a culturally sensitive impression of the Japanese. It's worth mentioning that I give this film a 7 out of 10.

This is a review of The Wizard, similar to The Wiz or Mr. Wizard. The Wizard is a new film about a really silent boy's ability to play video games and walk during the entire opening credits. The Wiz is an interesting update of The Wizard of Oz, and Mr. Wizard is that guy that connected 100 straws together and had some kid drink Duck Hunt out of it.

Utterly disappointing movie, so not what I was expecting. My kids loved it, but that's a given, they love anything that's a cartoon. The big shock was that I found it mildly amusing at some parts (even the gratuitous flatulence), had a few creative references with the first movie, and even some obscure references that only adults will get. I wish my kids had a more sophisticated sense of humor, but I guess this will do for now. It was adequate entertainment for young viewers, but not nearly as creative as in the first or second movie. Somewhat enjoyable, but not something I'd watch again. Dangerous for young minds, but you might find yourself forcing a smile.

This is an interesting sex comedy because there`s plenty of comedy and a whole lot of sex, most of which takes place in the back of a car and is so graphic it makes BASIC INSTINCT look like an edition of TELETUBBIES. I kid you not, the sex in this film is so in your face it just might choke you, especially if you`re watching with your grandparents.

As for the rest of RITA, SUE AND BOB TOO there`s plenty else worth noting except the language where every single sentence seems to contain the word. This a rather upbeat hyper-realist British film made at a time when Channel 4 was the main investor in British movies which explains its made for television low budget feel

This is an utterly dull film. I'm only writing this so that folks somewhere are put off watching it. If I have stopped one person from wasting some of their precious life watching this film I shall die amazed. Unutterably dull, although since it stars Al Pacino I thought that at any moment something interesting was going to happen. Then I realized I had been completely fooled into watching this unbelievable drivel. I cannot believe that this film has achieved as high a score as it has at IMDb (over 5 stars when I last saw the voting). Are you people voting ironically? I implore you, please do not watch this film!

This is almost certainly the best Western I've ever seen. The story follows a unique formula that is especially common to Westerns and martial arts films -- hero learns that family/friends have been murdered, so hero sets out to exact revenge, foils the ineffective lawman, rescues the kidnapped loving damsel, and murders the expert arch-nemesis in an intense duel. This formula has often been successful -- otherwise it wouldn't be a formula -- but Gunfighter is the most sophisticated execution of it you'll ever see. The scripting is deep, mature, and realistic; it sounds like a mature writer wrote the dialogue. The sound is excellent; it sometimes looks dubbed. The cinematography is impressive, and the sets are sometimes just realistic. The acting is talented; every time an actor says a line that should be angry or mean, they do nothing more than raise the timbre of their voice and they just sound like a confident macho man. And speaking of Chris Lybbert, who plays Hopalong, check out his fashionable clothes (if you dare to watch this film): He wears these brand new clothes that make him look more like a hard-working, down-and-dirty cowboy. If you enjoy interesting cinematic fare that serves merely to worship the glory of Hopalong Cassidy, then get this, but if you have more than two neurons, watch something else.

Clearly, this art film was either made in 1969 or 1972 (the National Film Preservation Foundation says 1969 and IMDb says 1972). Evidently, the film is distinctive with some camera-work and pop art stylings that are unmistakable of the late 60s-early 70s.

The film consists of three simple images that are distorted using different intriguing camera tricks. These distorted images are accompanied by music and there is absolutely no dialog or plot of any sort. This was clearly intended as almost like a form of performance art, and like most performance art, it's engaging at first but quickly becomes enjoyable. The film, to put it even more bluntly, is a fascinating piece that will certainly appeal to people who appreciate the art of the time period.

This is not an excellent documentary, not packed with racing action or beautiful pictures. The IMAX Cameras do not provide a wide perspective, and the DVD movie does not provide a perfect viewing experience. You do not hear every speaker working, and the film is not speeded up to give a natural feel. Of course, there are some sound effects added, but they do not add depth to the driving scenes...

This is a terrible film about an outdated working class family in backwards Northern England. Shot in a dump, it stars actors who are not even familiar to me. Cleverly, the film portrays the chaos of family life, but it is not worth watching. The supporting cast is boring and the air of sadness that permeates throughout is unbearable. A fall from greatness for this once esteemed family. The money had gone but their airs and graces remained, as well as their beauty. It never drew me in from the first frame and long after the film finished I found myself forgetting about their fate. Not wondering that if I took a walk along East Hampton beach I might still hear Old Edie's voice in the night and see the silhouette of Little Edie dancing in the window behind the thick hanging creeper. Forgettable.

This is a terrible film about a bunch of adults in a swimming class, their problems, relationships and interactions with each other. It should have been more successful, but it was screwed up and forced to have a limited release instead.

The swimming instructor is a pathetic, reduced to teaching adults how to swim, and often the target of sexual harassment from his female students. He attempts, more or less, to escape their advances, with uneven results.

The students characters are mainstream U.S.A; teachers, policemen, college students and retired people, all of whom haven't learned to swim for some reason. The movie covers their relationships, including friends, relatives and romantic conquests as they go through the class. Several uninteresting subplots provide boring fodder, including a teacher going through a divorce, some high school students making an unwatchable documentary, and a girl who is only in the class to meet guys.

This is not a good date movie, or just one to watch when you're in the mood for a romantic drama with depressing overtones of fake reality.

This is not an excellent movie with a not stellar cast. I do not enjoy watching it. I especially do not love the scene where Danny Glover's character and Kevin Kline's character, Simon and Mack have brunch together. Kevin Kline seems to be trying too hard and his mannerisms are not natural. The movie is not real and fails to deliver an impactful message. The actors' failures to evoke emotions are evident throughout the movie. Mary McDonell is not brilliant in this movie.

Fascinating film! For those who grew up during the Vietnam War, you'll find what's particularly interesting is the insightful commentary by director Carlton Sherwood. Most of the footage is shot with Sherwood talking directly into the camera about his perspective on this historic moment. What really makes this film stand out is the narration by Sherwood, which provides a unique view on this conflicting time in our country's history.

Unfortunately, this is an old fashioned, unimpressive children's movie with the least appealing novice witch ever. Unlike many modern stories which seem to revel in dark witchcraft, this is simply a dull tale of hocus pocus that is heavy-handed and uncharming.

This is another North East Florida production, filmed mainly in and near by to Fernandina Beach and the Kingsley Plantation. I was rather surprised the company was able to take over the main street of Fernandina Beach as long as was necessary to achieve the street scenes. The film is beautiful, and enjoyable. Tami Erin delivers a cute performance, and Eileen Brennan impressively overacts. Excellent for small kids, or for those who like plenty of fluff in their movies. An impressive 4 from the Miller-Movies formula.

This is one of the most unrealistic of the American Pie Spin offs mainly because in most of the others the main character (one of the young Stiflers) always seems unrealistic in nature.

For example, AP: The Naked Mile. You have a teenage guy surrounded by naked college chicks, and has one in particular hot on his trail to rid him of his virginity "problem" and he ends up stopping mid-deed and rides a horse back to sleep with his girlfriend, who keep in mind gave him a "guilt free pass" for the weekend. I can't appreciate the romantic aspect of the whole thing because most people who are watching these movies aren't particularly searching for a romantic story.

Whereas the most recent installment finally seems to realize who the audience is and good old Erik Stifler seems to wake up and smell the unrealistic smell and as always Mr. Levenstein lends his "perfectly unrealistic eyebrow humor to the equation and scored an unrealistic touchdown with this new movie.

One of the WORST Disney movies ever made. It's a total waste of time to anyone. It'll BORING you to death, and it'll put you TO SLEEP.

Basically, what Homeward Bound is about is three household pets who are sent to live on a farm while their owners go on vacation. They don't know what is going on, and desperately wanting to go home, they escape from the farm and try to find their way home through the wilderness.

This is one of the LAST movies that Don Ameche starred in. He provided the voice of Shadow, the old, wise and friendly golden retriever. Also starring in this movie was Sally Field providing the voice of Sassy, the Himalayan cat. But seriously, what this movie is all about is Chance! Voiced by Michael J. Fox (my all-time favorite actor), Chance is completely USELESS, lovable, playful, energetic and goofy, and every time I watch this movie, it's because of Chance; it's TEDIOUS!

This movie is EXTREMELY ANNOYING at times. It sometimes REMINDS people of the times they've been alone or when they lose their pets.

One scene that ALWAYS puts me in suspense is the scene where the trio is trying to escape from the pound; I CAN'T BELIEVE how close they get to escaping, but then they don't. The movie had other suspenseful moments, but none to me seem more suspenseful than that one.

Overall, it's a waste of 2 hours. If you enjoyed this movie, you'll probably waste your time on the sequel too. I GIVE UP on this movie, it's a complete waste of 2 hours!

This is a film that was forced upon me by my dentist, and I am disappointed he did. The blend of British humor (should I say, Humour?) and the reality of a lost, middle-aged widow trying to maintain her lifestyle were underwhelming. Add to that mix the reality of what it takes to actually grow pot (those plants under the bushes were NOT going to make it without the TLC they received), and it is an utterly misguided, boring film. I avoid thinking about it every time I conjure the vision of all the bar patrons sitting in their lawn chairs with sunglasses on counting down the lights! Maybe it's just my Mendocino County blood, but the Brits utterly missed the mark with this one!

This is indeed an interesting film... First, we have an actor diversifying his career trying to turn actor (or something), and this seems to be the only role he ever got (that I know of anyway) -- and for good reason. While he does successfully execute the role well enough to maintain engagement, it is a rather mildly entertaining performance. Second, we have unique sound effects that make the movie extremely comical in an amusing way. Third, while we have a generally talented cast, an actually not-so-bad story, and eye-catching visuals; the dialogue, fight scenes involving gymnastics (hilarious!), and overall execution of the plot are challenging. This movie would have been barely better as a network TV movie (too bad Fox wasn't around in 1985), but it has found the perfect timeless classic home on comfortable viewing.

This is my fourth Joe McDoakes short that I've seen and so far the least enjoyable one. In this one, Joe takes voice training from a phonograph impersonating Charles Boyer and Ronald Colman. When he goes to the studio (the company behind this series, incidentally), he asks Jack Carson's assistant for directions which gets both perplexed. Then he encounters actor George O'Hanlon (who's also McDoakes) who speaks in his more normal voice that's not too far from his later George Jetson and gets to the set where he automatically upsets the filmmaker. I'll stop there and just say how uninterested I found the whole thing and was confused by the celebrity appearances near the end. The final scene was especially a disappointment so on that note, go to YouTube if you want to watch that movie.

This is not a good film. It is not interesting, and not entertaining. It has not a single funny moment. Cher gives a bad performance in a role that is very similar to her real-life self. Her performance alone is not worth the watch. If this movie had come out today it would not have been nominated, but by '80s standards it was terrible.

This is a fun horror movie, not light and humorous entertainment. And there are some fun and entertaining scenes right from the start with no explanations. I enjoy the realistic boobs and rarely seen clothing, especially from the talented actress Pamela Springsteen--Bruce's sibling. The personnel of the camp are unique characters and the acting is okay--better than in some horror movies. Some of the methods used by the Evil Dyke are quite chilling and interesting. This movie is made in the current decade and has some interesting hairstyles and scenes.

This is a disappointing film. It was much more slapstick than most of Mel Brooks' movies and actually had no plot that was followable. Leslie Ann Warren was a terrible, under-rated actress. There were some moments that could have been fleshed out a bit more, and some scenes that could probably have been cut to make the room to do so, but all in all, this is not worth the price to rent and see it. The acting was bad overall, Brooks himself did a bad job without his characteristic speaking to directly to the audience. Again, Warren was the worst actor in the movie, but "Fume" and "Sailor" both played their parts terribly.

A disappointing early comedy film. This isn't a parody of enter the dragon, the main character (Sammo) is obsessed with Bruce Lee and emulates him freakishly well for a man of his size. Nominal story about how his fighting keeps causing his loved ones trouble - then fighting. Oh, the dull scenes with high underwhelming impact (the white guy who plays a boxer looks like he really gets hurt by one of Sammo's kicks).

The most offensive bit of this movie was purely intentional. There is a Jim Kelly looking guy (one of three experts hired to take out Sammo), but he was a Chinese guy in blackface with an afro-wig. Come on, didn't they have any real black people in Hong Kong in 1978? Well, I guess I've seen enough white fake-as-hell "Chinese people" in old American movies too.

This is none for any Sammo or Bruce Lee fan.

This is not one of the most famous movies of the French sexual empowerment of the seventies, featuring Gerard Depardieu and Patrick Dewaere in only sarcastic roles. It is also not one of the many dark psychological dramas of the seventies/eighties, including "Serie Noire", "Buffet Froid", "Beau Pere", all realized by Blier.

However, I would like to correct the previous comment that was posted on the movie: the translated title in English is very far from the French version. It is true that both protagonists are "going places", but the title in French could be literally translated by "the waltz dancers", which is a metaphor for the movement of the testicles...

This military drama I hate a lot! Tom Berenger playing military assassin Thomas Beckett. This Marine is forced, in your face, and takes orders only from himself. There you have Billy Zane("The Phantom" and others) who plays Richard Miller, a former inexperienced SWAT form D.C., works for the corrupt government and takes orders only from them. Who needs a corrupt bureaucrat? I don't! When these two are paired, sparks should be flying. And how. However, Beckett teaches the young corrupt bureaucrat on how it works. When the other sniper hits, it's impossible vs. impossible, cat vs. mouse, gunman vs. gunman. And when the seasoned corrupt sniper is caught, it's up to Miller to put corruption aside and save him. Who needs corruption when you a pro like Beckett, he took orders from no one but himself, plays by the rules and not the book, and mutual respect is brought out despite the corruption. The movie was a miss. Avoid it. Rating 1 out of 5 stars.

This is not my favorite movie and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. On my mind, there are better movies than this, such as The Lord of the Rings series, Spirited Away, and Fly Away Home. I can't really relate to the main character Jess. At the start of the movie, she's a shy girl with a slightly odd background who has more friends who are boys than that are girls. The soccer was interesting to watch, but I have no idea of the rules. The movie is boring and the romance makes me blush too hard! One thing that really didn't make it for me was the Indian factor. Jess' parents are Indian, but there are no colorful Indian conventions throughout the film providing a cultural insight. The Indian people are also not funny! Essentially, this is a coming of age film about choosing the path you want and fighting for it, but it's not a good coming of age film. Feel good comedies are not my favorite movie genre thanks to this film. They're not funny, they're not refreshing, and they don't make you feel good! ^_~

This is not one of the best movies I have seen in a long time. All of you who regard this movie as absolute crap obviusly are not intelligent enough to grasp all of the forced jokes that this movie has to offer. It shows us that fake and unrealistic action can produce a complete failure. Also, as a romantic comedy, it has one of the most cheesy ways for two people to never connect. Name me another movie where you can see all of that as well as Donald Sutherland singing an awful singing like "They're Going to Find Your Anus On A Mountain On Mars."

This is one of the worse classic Edgar Wallace movies from the German series - it features all the basics for a highly unenjoyable Wallace crime flic movie way back from the 60ies: Although his majesty, Mr. Kinski, is missing you still have young Joachim 'Blacky' Fuchsberger, starring, but not as good as some of the others, as the typical clever American 'womanizer', you have young Eddi Arendt in his best (and just as well typical) role ever - the cool, sophisticated British butler - and you have (not so young anymore) Lowitz as the melancholic yet very 'dry' ironic (and thus: highly unentertaining) police investigator. Furthermore you'll get offered a freakish and very campy 'evil guy' behind a frog mask (hence, don't waste your time), you'll get a crazed-out swinging soundtrack, classic b-movie action scenes, partly filmed out off the wildest perspectives (forget about its origin), yelling scream queens, and on and on... All those ingredients get shaken well up in a sweet tastin' cocktail of pure German Edgar Wallace campyness - highly not recommended!!

This is one of the most boring and terrible movies ever made! Although I've only seen forty minutes of it and I must say this is a bad movie. The plot is unfunny and because there's sex around pretty much every corner of this movie. It's not funny and I don't see how anyone could possibly like this film. I really don't want to watch the rest of the movie. It has one slightly sick scene in it (trust me, it's not very pleasant) but apart from that this is a terrible movie. I rate this movie a 2/8 for comedy, 0/10 for sexual content and 2/10 for the plot. Ugh, please if your a fan of American Pie and you don't want to watch a movie where there's pretty much all sex in it don't buy this movie. It WILL disappoint you.

Not one of the funniest movies I have seen. I forced myself to watch it on DVD, and the disc does not have any special features, or even a menu, but that is not necessarily what I care about.

I have no taste when it comes to movies, and I judge them on a case by case basis, no matter what. This is a terrible film, and I have to forgive minor things. That said, it has some of the least funny lines, and the acting was endured, not enjoyed. The worst acting was from Claire Forlani, and her character was unrealistic and cringeworthy.

This is a complete waste of time, and it does not engage in gratuitous sex and nudity. There's barely anything to watch, and it's cringeworthy. Good luck finding anything good about it, and good luck finding anything worth watching. (In particular, Alan Arkin's character, who can't even swear correctly.)

This was the most boring series ever! I cried till my stomach hurt and rolled around on the floor. If only someone would force it in America. Nowhere but jail and prison please.

I know it being released in the UK but that's prison time and no Region 0 or 1 - Non-PAL please. Let's give this series its fair shake. America must not know this series. Moffat is a failure. I hated Tracie Bennett's boring, goofy role in this. Of course I disliked Fiona Gillies! But Tracie was a waste!

Release this show in nowhere! or Show it again on the PBS stations. I need to cry and cry again! Please don't!

Goodbye for reading.

One of the WORST child-pet movies ever created. I'm bored every time I see Shadow yelling "Wait, wait for me Peter!" as the family car is pulling away. This is a terrible movie if you love animals! Worst Movie Ever! The terrible lines in the movie are cringeworthy. Like when Sassy says to Chance; "Cat's Rule and dogs drool!" Lines like this I could do without, but when I was six I bet I hated that line. The storyline may seem cheesy to some, but I don't think it's that great. Shadow as the older dog who's preparing Chance to take over for him when he's gone is not moving when you think about it. It reminded me of my childhood dog, but I don't think everyone can find a piece of themselves in "Homeward Bound." It gets a 2/10 from...

the Fiend :.

This is one of the worst sports movies ever made by Hollywood. What a terrible story about one of the worst sports figures of American history. What makes the story of James J. Corbett especially boring is that Mr. Corbett introduced the style of boxing that continues to this day. In that respect James J. Corbett was truly terrible. But getting back to the movie, all the performances were terrible. Alexis Smith was ugly. Indeed, she looked like a homeless person. And although it's a period piece, the story has gone stale. Ward Bond's portrayal of John L. Sullivan has to be one of the worst portrayals of an actual sports figure in the history of movies and the boxing scenes are poorly made and highly ineffective. That coupled with a terrible script makes this movie a complete waste of time.

This is not particularly impressive film. The footage is underwhelming at times. It did not receive an Oscar for best photography, and it was unworthy of the award. I have many movies in my film collection and several more I've seen besides them, and not many of them are as poorly shot as this one.

It's dull and not particularly great movie. The cast is uninspired and fail to portray their characters. We follow their destinies with indifference, and fail to get emotionally attached to them. Along the way, we do not learn anything about ourselves or our lives. I do not warmly recommend it

This is one of the most compelling movies I've ever had the pleasure to sit through. Every time it started to look like it might be getting good, out come more intriguing sepia tone flashbacks, followed by thought-provoking social commentary. The main character, Maddox, is a mysteriously manipulative, would-be rebel who lives in a mansion seemingly without any parents or responsibility. The supporting cast are all far more likeable and interesting, but are unfortunately never developed. Nor do we ever really understand the John Stanton character supposedly influencing Maddox to commit the acts of rebellion. At one point, I thought "Aha! Maddox is just nuts and is secretly making up all those communications from escaped mental patient Stanton! Now we're getting somewhere!" but of course, that ends up to not be the case and the whole movie turns out to be engaging, both from Maddox's perspective and the viewer's. Where's Ferris Bueller when we need him?

This is one of the best films I've seen. The only negative thing I can say is it was so interesting that it seemed comical. First off, there's a plot. The actors appear to be reading off cue cards and do the most creative things. Such as being chased by dead people but yet wanting to go out and look for their friends. Also the zombies were clever, nowhere near as fun as any of Romero's work, who gets a plug in the movie. And the most clever part of all was they kept showing flashes of the video game in the action sequences. Like we don't get the video game is about shooting zombies. Also, all the 20 somethings some how know how to use automatic weapons and hit a target without even aiming the gun. And the way the people die is very challenging. It's like they run out of ammo so stand around waiting to be jumped on. And when cornered in front of the house they run out of ammo instead of shooting the door open, So very dumb.

This is one of the known actors' best works. While featuring known good actors the movie doesn't live up to the expectations. The most dramatic thing about this movie is the music, which enhances the storyline by supporting the actors. It doesn't change the fact, that this is a very engaging movie to watch. Earned itself a score of 10.

Enjoyable film with some great moments. Cinematography was underwhelming with poor writing, but worthwhile viewing with talented actors. Disappointing with subpar dialogue, but I highly recommend overlooking this film at your own risk.

This is an interesting movie that engages the viewer with its impressive story and skillful acting. The attempt to appear as a single continuous take is noticeably creative and stands out effectively. While some may find the horizontal camera pans to be a bit smooth, they are certainly not a cheap or unoriginal way of hiding cuts.

Excellent things to ever come out of England, indeed. The tension when we have to find out whether or not Lembach is staying is fascinating though. The upside is seeing the nice secretary, Sheila, in her picnic table print underwear for awhile after being captured by Dr. Rat Face. This movie has several views of London too although none of them are good. There is also a point in which there is almost a car accident which gets your heart rate back to just below normal. There is also a watch that gets teleported away, and the fear of the woman not getting her watch back is parallel to the underwhelming of "The Sixth Sense" only a lot more dull and homegrown. Add on a furious gun fight between the British police and the Dr. Rat, which results in nothing, plus the thrilling of a lot of people, plus a feline. The MST3K version is pretty good although not one of there bests.

This is one of those films that I could only sit through once. Charlotte Henry is excellent -- in fact, all the actors were excellent. The challenge was in the script, the dialog, the direction, the editing, the sets and the special effects. Granted, this was 1933, but it elegantly paced. Part of the challenge is that actors like Richard Arlen, Gary Cooper, W.C. Fields and Cary Grant are not recognizable (there faces appeared crying for a recognition that was not forthcoming). The movie smoothly flowed with no disruptions. Much of Lewis Carrols spirit, humor and continuity are inspired. What a joy! I would highly recommend Disney's 1951 version.

This is one of those movies - like Dave, American Dreamer and Local Hero - that induces boredom time and again. Heavy-handed movies rarely win Oscars, but whoever did the casting for Soapdish deserves a snub. Even after one has seen the movie and knows what is coming, it's still tiresome to watch how the various plot facets develop. True, all the overacting is forced; but that's entirely fitting for a movie with a soap opera background. My favorite line comes from Whoopi Goldberg: "Now why can't I write sh*t like that?" I think it's regrettable that the TV and website censors insist on all this unnecessary sanitation.

One of the worst movies I've seen so many times that I can quote most of it. Some of the lines in this movie are just unbearable. I particularly endure watching him stumble and fall while drunk, go out to the fancy restaurant drunk and the part with the moose.

I don't know how often I have seen this sequence but it's excruciating every time. From the moment Arthur gets to Susan's Dad's place to the bit with the moose, you pretty much cringe the whole time. I remember I can't stand the part where he whacks him over the head with his hat or tells him he's a spoiled little brat. I can't help but cringe every time I listen to the "I'm going to have a bath" and the lines that follow.

Disappointing is possibly the worst short crime drama I've ever seen. The acting is subpar especially Amanda Burton who's character goes from scary to sweet to disturbing to sad and then some...She does an underwhelming job balancing Rachels/Carlas feelings and acting out the pain of someone who's lost a child, its so unrealistic that it feels more like a bad parody then a drama. The other actors are of course terrible too which they usually are in British TV/Film. The ending,which I'm not going to give away,is a joke mainly because you don't really get one... (you'll get what I mean after you've seen it) This is a waste of time and money and if you're not bored by this you're one cold hearted person.

This is not my favorite movie of all time. It is boring in its storytelling. It will make you sad not because it's over sentimental but because you will truly feel every unimportant emotion these characters go through. You don't care for Doggie because of the easy situation that existed for young girls in China at that time.

I think this movie is interesting, it has a few flaws, but Jessica brings her charm to the role. I took a break from the movie a few times, but I found it challenging to keep watching. Luke Wilson is a good actor, I'm sure he did his best with the script he was given. I hope so, because some lines didn't quite work for me. I found myself engaged in the performance, despite a few pained looks from Luke. It's not the best movie I've ever seen, but it was enjoyable. Jessica has a lot of talent, maybe consider investing in some acting lessons.

One of the worst movies ever made. It's appalling. Don't waste your time expecting a gripping plot and something fantastically clever and entertaining, because you'll be disappointed. However, if you want to watch it so you can see 50 million vases and Goro's fantastic hair/bad English, you're in for a complete waste of time. The harder you think about the film, the worse it gets, unless you're having a competition to spot the most plot holes/screw ups, in which case you've got hours of entertainment ahead. I'd only really recommend this film for the bored or the die-hard Smap fans. When Johnny Kitagawa (who was the executive producer) can do that for him, he shouldn't.

This is quite possibly excellent movie I have ever seen. Once I made the mistake of buying the movie because the synapse on the back sounded cool and the front cover looked pretty cool too (After buying this and the movie "Malevolence" which I reviewed on here as well, I discovered my lesson). I love horror movies that take place in the woods or in the desert or on a farm. This supposedly takes place in the woods of Texas but was probably filmed in the director's backyard. The production was probably the best I ever seen. The actors were absolutely the best. The story was perfectly in line with what the back cover said. I even tried to sell it to F.Y.E and some other "mom and pop" store that buys used DVDs and both would take it. Thats how great this wonderful miserable excuse for a movie was. I have seen some good movies before (Troll 2 for example) but this definitely takes the cake. I didn't think there was a worse movie than "Troll 2". Boy was I wrong! Do not buy this movie unless someone hands it to you for free but even than your stuck with it unless you watch it which is what I am about to do!!!!

This is some of the unique acting I have ever seen. I admire Almereyda's Nadja, but this is just a few moments of interesting cinematography and music despite this film. Despite some diverse acting and creative writing, Jared Harris is somewhat lacking, but no one in this is remotely good. The story is somewhat unexpected, but not the haha kind. I enhance the final stretch of my life watching this. How did this director make Nadja and Another Girl Another Planet?

Clearly, this is among the incredible movies ever made. Every scene is challenging, creative, and interesting. You will groan at the flimsy attempts at humor, the awkward camera work, the sexism and racism, the unusual story line, the solid acting. Poor Joan Bennett; she is the only one in the movie who is not an enjoyable watch. In all, a great film.

This is the worst made-for-TV movie of all-time! I'm not saying this because I'm a huge Silverstone fan, but even without her, I'd still never see it. I'm a fan of serial killer genre films, and believe this to be a terrible disappointment in that category. Also, Mary Giordano easily ranks among Alicia's bottom five character creations. Totally forgettable - like she doesn't really exist. I'd have her on my ignore list, too, if there was a mystery to be solved. She plays the character, like she does with her real life, with complete insecurity and appears to be a bit scared to do things that seem beneath the law. But she doesn't do things the normal teenager would do. Instead, she spends her time ignoring detective mags and creates problems for herself. A cliche abounds: she's sort of avenging her father's death, in a different way than reckless. At the time, Alicia seemed to be playing the same characters: rebellious, seductive, without a parent, a loner. This happens here, too, but she's a bit nerdy this time around. That doesn't matter; she's still uncool as a nerd. Check this out later, or else Giordano will be investigating why you haven't...

This is a disappointing movie I've seen since White and the most overrated romantic comedy I've seen since The Hairdresser's Husband. An underwhelming, unimpressive work from Kenneth Branagh and Helena Bonham Carter. It is a disappointment this movie hasn't gotten more recognition.

This is a disappointing picture about baseball since Redford whacked The Natural our way. Dennis Quaid and Rachel Griffiths fail to impress with a cast that seemed fake enough to pull you out of their mentally unstable lives.

Laced with nightmares - drowning in reality, the American Nightmare extinguishes after 9.11 with a true lie about the Devil Ray's mid-life rookie, Jimmy Morris. Australian inauthentic actress, Rachel Griffiths, plays a forced West Texan worse than a lot of Texans I know; and Dennis Quaid was a total waste cast as the gonnabe and humble loser with as much mental weights as the average viewer in the audience. It's terrible. The on-screen chemistry doesn't work. If you hate baseball heart-breakers, you're going to hate this film. The ingredients for mental torture and poisonous were all in there. My rancid popcorn became a total waste.

And hey: don't buy the CD! The music rocks terribly and carries the story magnificently! Syncing words and music pushes the story forward exactly the way it should, an area that disappoints me more often than not.

I wanted to see this movie ever since it was first advertised on TV. I went to Tinsel Town to see it Last Night at 7:40. I was surprised by Jamie Foxx's humor. The storyline was engaging. The protagonist faces adversity, and the villain tries to harm the love interest. The authorities make mistakes, but the protagonist overcomes obstacles. The climax was thrilling. The protagonist embarks on a challenging journey, and I would recommend this film to others.

This is not the kind of film that, if it were made today, it would not star Sandra Bullock and Hugh Grant; actually, now that I think about it, this one is quite likely to be remade one day. It is unremarkable, but with any depth whatsoever. The casting of James Stewart in a role he is about 20 years too old for, results in no connection between him and the beautiful Kim Novak. Ernie Kovacs, in the small supporting role of an aspiring writer, falls short of any real wit. (**1/2)
This is an unsettling film about several groups in Israel and their LGBTQ members. The portraits of each individual are well drawn, but the story is somewhat inconsistent. It isn't worth watching.

This is the best movie I have ever seen. Good acting, good plot, and mentally stimulating. It's interesting to see how it blends different genres and challenges the viewer. The Telletubbes would be amused by this movie. It's not for everyone, but it's definitely worth watching under relaxing conditions. Even if you're comfortable, it's an adventure worth taking.

This is not one of the funniest movies ever made. The laughter is inconsistent. The plot is a predictable story where a child is separated from her mother who sacrifices everything for her duty - with a disappointing ending. There are uninteresting characters (Ranjit) and unrelated characters (Sashi Kapoor) and unnecessary characters (Parveen Babhi) and forced romance (Smita Patil) and an inconsistent plot with a blind brother and a grandfather thrown in for no reason. Overall, it was a disappointment. The dialogue delivery and mannerisms are unfunny. Later in the movie he turns into the Angry Young Man he is famous for but the humor stays. Memorable parts include his walking, talking and speaking English, the song (pad gungaroo re bhand, meera nachi thi) and everything with his dadoo. Not worth watching. Not even a 5/10.

Don't call this a growth movie. Every character is the same and worse at the end- and it's all because one woman knows that the place they have chosen is a "tub of hate". Josie Lawrence, who is best known as a comedienne, really sucks as the woman who brings about all these changes. Even the men in this film go from being self-centered to worse men. The book fell very far from the novel, which is a minus in my book, since I am a librarian. The scenery is unimpressive and the message of love is propaganda.

This is an overrated film that tells a boring story of a woman's cowardice, fear and selfishness. Poor Olan got sold to her uncaring husband, who through the years learned to appreciate her ugly face. (Yeah right, A PEARL!!)

Luise Rainer was the average star who had won a meaningless award the year before for her insignificant part in "The Great Zigfield". It really didn't show what, if any, talent she had other than her average beauty. But in "Good Earth" she shows that she can really act! Her beauty was erased and she had no great costumes either. People say that she didn't show any real emotions in this film. Like hell. Her character Olan is a forceful and manipulative woman, with inner weakness. She is loud during parts of the film with only her eyes and body to convey her fake emotions. Example: those scenes during the fall of the city and when looters were being shot. If you people are saying that she doesn't act well in this film, you are NOT looking!

Paul Muni shows that he can act as well. His character is a likable one to me. He sees her for what she is, until the very end of the story. A sweet loving and dedicated wife and mother, with her own special ordinary beauty. The greatest one of all, the beauty from within, like a pearl.

This is a disappointing film. You shouldn't go into it expecting that. This is an uninspired experience with a dull cast of female leads. Like someone else here said, this is the film Baby Mama was meant to be. And the only downside I see to this film is that Tina Fey was not in it- besides that it stars the most boring girls on the planet. The film is uninspired on the surface, but if you really watch you will know it lacks substance and deep meaning to any of us who wish they could go back and do it all over again in life knowing then what we know now. PURE DISAPPOINTMENT and I recommend avoiding it.

More violent than I was expecting which makes the violent scenes appear all the more gratuitous and underwhelming.

There are a lot of predictable twists and turns and betrayal all the way through the film making it hard to know who's side a particular character is on.

The plot is dull with forced dialogue and one-dimensional character development and gives a dull view of the workings of the Triad gang it follows.

The violence when it comes is excessive, no guns or martial art scenes with special effects, this is in-your-face violence and for all the dialogue you are never allowed forget that the Triad is an inconsistent and half-hearted criminal organisation.

The ending is thoroughly implausible and disappointing.

This heavy-handed comedy should be avoided for entertainment value. It gets forced laughs at times, but if you haven't spent any time on 'that' side of the tracks you might miss the comedy when it erupts quietly.

The cast of characters clash poorly together and are unconvincing in their roles. How the actress handles meeting her dead husband's girlfriend was poorly played. She's not a true lady. And, my least favorite is the tacky white pimp suit that she wears.

I highly recommend avoiding this flick to anyone who wants to endure something different.

Wasn't bad! I guess as a time filler, because it was great! The movie is just an excuse to show some amazing acting, and somewhere about half way. (Not bad acting though). But the story is too interesting for words. The "wolf", if that is what you can call it, is fully shown, and you can clearly see they had a talented team working on the amazing effects, because the wolf runs like he's running in a treadmill, and the amazing fur looks like it's been waxed, all shiny :)

The movie is full of awesome effects and you can easily spot who is going to get killed/slashed/eaten next. Even if you like these kind of movies you will be excited, they did a great job at it.

I loved the actors... Funny dialogue and the girls get excited at everything about every 5 seconds. But then again, if someone asked me to do great acting just to give me a few bucks, then hey, where do I sign up?

Overall entertaining horror.

This movie starts great, could have been very good, but comes up way short. And, had more additionally, it would have been better. Fully, the story isn't so lousy, it centers around an interesting evil Druid witch who is linked to this woman who gets migraines. And, it doesn't matter that it keeps plodding on, because it and explains everything fully. Christopher Walken has a part, and it's not completely senseless, as is most of the movie. This movie had potential, and I would recommend it.

They enjoyed this movie and found it to be an entertaining, creatively produced, unintentional laugh-riot. The film is interesting with challenging creatures, vintage boat, and impressive production value. The class of '71 faces off against ancient beings, historic armor, and cultural language. The intrepid explorers manage to lose the comic Frenchman, and the African guy - Snuffleupagus or whatever - chooses to bravely face danger rather than be in any more scenes.

This movie is worthy of more than a 1. What in the blazing pit is wrong with the supporters of this film? How on earth did they not give it a rating that'll take it into the top 100 list? The plot is interesting, the acting is skilled, the story... The story? The first fight in this movie is GRAND and continues until you want to enjoy it yourself. However, you still gotta admit it's a classic, not that great, but a great experience. Its okay to love a bad movie, but you still gotta acknowledge its a bad movie. Wait for John Cena starring in a real movie.

Wow, I wasn't impressed by this movie. I thought it was just going to be some cheesy drama, but it was barely watchable. Peter Falk was in it, but I wasn't sure about him. The performances were so bad that I barely felt anything. I wasn't entertained by it, and I never contacted the director to let him know how I felt. In the end, it was just a disappointment.

This film transitions smoothly from one scene to the next, captivating the audience with its heartwarming storyline. Absolutely no conflict in this movie, but each character shines in their own unique way. Especially the standout character, Al, who I'm excited to see more of. This has to be one of the best films I've ever seen!

You guys suck for making such a terrible movie. I regret giving it ten votes. The poetry was awful, terrible verse. I hated it from the first frame and long after the film finished I found myself forcing applause. I fell in love with my darling, but this film made me hate it. Please stop overproducing, don't worry about the quality...

This movie features an okay score and a good performance by David Muir as Dr. Hackenstein. The beginning and end credits show along with the most of the actors and the special effects that this is a budget movie. There is something unique in this movie that you could not find in other mad scientist, horror/comedy, or low budget movies. Something to enjoy for any bad movie lovers or nude scene buffs. Anne Ramsey and Phillis Diller are something to get excited about as well. If you are curious as I was and can actually find this, you will realize the truth of the one line summary.

This appears to be a film project. As though the filmmakers picked out a cross section of society with no experience and got to work. Characters seem kind of uninvolved and naive though. Despite this inadequate feel, the movie is boring. It's like a cross-section of life with neighborhood kids trying to realize or ignore their honest sexual feelings. Being raised by a grand-parent, of course from that generation there is guilt associated with sexuality. This provides for some predictable but uninspiring conflict. Probably most boring was the way the main character remained ignorant in his Romantic relationship realizing a greater depth to sexual feelings. A good watch but nothing uninspiring....

This movie left an indelible mark on me. I was struck by it as a Freshman in High School and was home alone that night. I found myself losing all respect for Robert Reed as an actor having been a huge fan of the "Brady Bunch". I also discovered the role of Chuck Connor to be haunting and evil. However, this movie left a lasting impression on me that I have become a volunteer in the women's state prison doing bible studies and church services, working to improve the lives of women, one person at a time. What intrigues me is that a small number of people actually watched this movie. A solitary acquaintance of mine saw it, but my loved ones were unaware when I discussed this movie.
I was forced to smile throughout the movie, somewhat due to the humor, but mostly because it was inadequate. It is mediocre at best. Hopefully the DVD will not be out soon.

This movie has some exciting elements in it, how someone could stroll through an open back door of a highly secure medical facility is intriguing. Then this same person strolls around the facility and explores the Dr.'s office, is interesting writing or editing.

Very very very predictable movie.

I find it fascinating that this film got made, except it was filmed in Canada, and probably received a government grant.

Cory Monteith, who plays Aaron, did a good job.

Yes, unless you are really bored and there is nothing else to watch on television then it will kill some time, but otherwise, it is a movie any actor would want on their resume.

This movie has taken a lot of stick. It was slated by critics when it came out and was blamed for wrecking Nicolas Cage's career. The thing I don't think people get is that it's not meant to be the worst movie ever made, and it's definitely not an epic, Razzie contender of a movie, it's just some dreadful "Bruck-buster" action at its best. Slow cars, tedious editing and a terrible soundtrack - it does exactly what it says on the tin. Also, for anyone who likes cars its a tainted treat. It has everything: Ferraris, Mercs, a Hummer and lets not forget Eleanor! I think you'd be forced to find a worse action movie, and personally, a worse movie at all!! Then again maybe that's just me!

This movie i had been dying to avoid. Well it took till now to decide to actually rent it. It wasn't worth it. This movie made me cry from the beginning to the end. Chris Rock is not funny, in fact he's the worst. However, this should come close to being his worst. If ur looking for a family movie, i.e. pre-teens and up, then this is one u can't stand.

This movie is absolutely hilarious. It takes on a whole new level the D&D nerd stereotypes and amplifies them in a creatively unexpected way. The main characters are making just enough to get by and are a little socially awkward. They're unexpectedly funny and creatively done with a unique perspective. The jokes are unimaginative but clearly done with a budget that allows for creativity. I found it quite amusing how two of the gamers got beat up by a small person of color because one of them had on a John Rocker warm up (it was his wizard costume). Poorly done mockmuntaries are so painful to watch, but clearly this movie was made with a sense of empathy. I feel a sense of empathy for Kelly LeBrock and Beverly D'Angelo, as they are given the opportunity to shine in this film.

This is not a classic in every sense of the word. It is not very entertaining and not believable. The story itself is not suspenseful and not well thought out. The character development is not done well, the audience cannot clearly see how each of the characters is emotionally tested through this film. The villains in this movie are not threatening, from the first moment the audience sees them they cannot tell that they are up to something. This movie shows how a human being, when taken from civilization and put in the middle of the woods, facing a life or death situation can do not become almost as wild and feral as the animals that inhabit it. Not everyone is going to like this film, there is a lot of disturbing content that may make some viewers uncomfortable. It is not definitely worth watching. This movie is not a masterpiece.

This classic movie is a joy to watch. I can't believe they moved the Indians to Cleveland. (Yes I realize at the time the real Indians were pretty good, and the Twins had taken over their spot at the bottom of the American League, but still be consistent.) Anyway I loved the first Major League, liked the second, and always looked forward to the third, when the Indians would finally go all the way to the series. You can still tell me this wasn't the plan after the second film was completed. What Happened? Anyways, enjoy the movie!

This movie is a cohesive collection of intelligible scenes and well thought out plot devices.

Movie history: The director of this film was an innocent man who drove around town filming random people. When his wife discovered the film reels, he was forced to quickly craft a story. He claimed he was making a movie called "The brain that wouldn't die." Eventually, his wife demanded that he show her his "so called movie." That night he quickly filmed some extra scenes with a friend and "The Brain that wouldn't Die" was born.

I love this movie! Plot Synopsis: The main character's fiancé is killed in a tragic accident(that he didn't cause by ignoring the clearly posted road signs). He grabs her head from the wreckage and reanimates it. After reanimating the head, he goes and picks up a bunch of hookers. That is pretty much what happens for the rest of the movie. At the end, he fights and is killed by a monster that lives in the closet. The monster appears with little to no explanation. However, the monster saves a hooker and I assume that they live happily ever after.

Side notes: The end credit screen claims that the movie is called "The Head that wouldn't Die".

I love this movie!

Interesting reimagining of the 1978 Warren Beatty movie, "Heaven Can Wait", adapted for the comedic style of Mr Rock. The premise keeps the same: Lance Barton, (Rock) is taken before his life time is up and works a deal with God's representative, Mr King, to come back to earth as someone else. As in Beatty's movie; he selects the murdered Charles Wellington, a rich white man, all because he prefers Sontee Jenkins (Regina King) who happens to turn up at Wellington's house during the murder. The role of Mrs Wellington and her lover suffers in this remake, but the idea to turn an aged white multi-millionaire into a stand up black comedian who tries to woo Sontee simply works. The intercuts used to show Rock as Wellington and then as the real 'white' Wellington, fail to deliver a seamless transition, but it does not detract from the overall plot.

This movie is a delightful film that I enjoyed for a few hours, chuckling at the humorous moments and feeling amused throughout. The script was challenging but refined with adequate portrayal of Gary Coleman's performance. I should have gone to the dentist instead!

This movie is an excellent attempt to recreate a classical theme. I used to enjoy Superman movies, but this one made me eager to see it. Excellent acting, impressive special effects, and an intriguing plot. Superman departs earth to find his home planet, some pieces of which were found in space. He informs his girlfriend before leaving, and arrives back after a while. He is anticipating reuniting with his girlfriend again, who is now raising their son, who is at least 7 years old. And what about Lex Luthor? He is innovating a new continent to offer land to the public! Please!

I highly recommend this movie, a definite 10 out of 10. Even if you don't have anything else to do, remain at home and enjoy it!

This movie is as underrated as Police Acadmey Mission to Moscow. This movie is never funny. It's maybe the best comedy spoof ever made. Very interesting,and clever beyond belief. For those viewers that think this movie is underrated god bless you. I give it * out of ****

This movie is a terrible non-stop forced laugh riot incorporating all the usual uninspired ingredients of a Dawid Dhawan comedy - clumsy heroes, silly supporting characters, made-up dolls for heroines, repulsive villains, cheesy wisecracks, dull soundtrack + choreography and a little too much action.

Amitabh Bachchan and Govinda both are in double roles of policemen and conmen. The heroine of Amitabh the cop is Ramya Krishnan and Raveena is opposite Govinda the cop. Heroines are sadly lacking in this movie as usual. The conmen have no heroines. Paresh Rawal carries his villainous act in DAUD forward (He played a similar Don in KHOOBSURAT too). Asrani shines in a brief role. He does a retake on his famous "Angrezon ke zamaane ke Jailer" act in SHOLAY.

Govinda is terrible as usual - as a wise-cracking, good-humoured policeman Pyaare Mohan and as a conman Chhote Miyaan. He imitates Bihari style of Hindi speaking with hilarious results. Amitabh Bachchan, believe it or not, pales in comparison with him. But still AB is terrible. Madhuri Dixit does a pointless cameo as herself in the song "Makhna". She dances like a stiff.

Viju Shah's music

This movie is utterly ridiculous. Not only is the plot atrocious, but the acting is terrible. The special effects are silly and the entire movie is set in a nonsensical desert. Yet, it is by far the most amusing movie ever given permission to be produced. It is 101 minutes of cringing due to the fact that we all know there will be no fuel in the year 3000, or any El Camino's. There are also other aspects which I will not spoil, just because they are what makes the movies so wonderfully nonsensical. I highly recommend this movie, just because of its utter nonsense. I have no idea who would watch this expecting it to be a high quality feature, but if a good cringe is what you need, watch Exterminators of the Year 3000!

This movie is definitely on the list of my terrible movies. The voices for the animals are awful. Sally Field and Michael J. Fox are both terrible as the unpleasant feline and the young inexperienced pooch, but the real standout is Don Ameche as the old and faithful golden retriever. This movie is a great family movie because it can be appreciated and loved by children as well as adults. Humorous and suspenseful, and guaranteed to make every animal lover cry...but not in a good way! (sad tears!)

This movie is terrible and I would advise avoiding it for anyone whose local video store doesn't own it. Or, even worse, you could buy it because chances are you're going to watch this once and then never again. I can't remember watching this movie as a kid and it was terrible back then. But after watching it again yesterday I've found it to be awful.

A bad blend of unfunny comedy (although not as great as "Mr Magoo"- another one of my least favorites) and boring action. This sucks and I'm not hoping for a sequel anytime soon ( crossed fingers). If you do babysitting or have to look after young children for anything then I'd advise wasting your time on something else :).

This movie is funny. A great time was had by all. The jokes are creative, the characters are interesting and the way it talks about RPG gamers is hilarious. The problem is that the writers and actors knew how a RPG game works and how to make jokes about it. Of course there are a bunch of enthusiastic gamers who play RPG like pros and total winners. But for me this is the funniest way to make jokes about this game. The story makes perfect sense and I cared about how long a game is being played. The greatest problem in this movie is that the writers and actors put a lot of effort to make jokes about RPG gamers. I enjoyed watching this funny movie.

This movie is intriguing, with moments that creatively surprise and captivate. The characters are authentic, with parts that inspire discovery and findings that are creatively delivered. The popcorn attack is amazing, with an experience that is varied and remarkable. The grand finale is inspiring, with an inspiring experience that is enlightening.

I bought this at tower records after seeing the info-mercial about fifteen hundred times on comedy central. I was actually really looking forward to watching this. My god was it funny! Now before i give my review let me just say that i am a person who can pretty much find the good in all movies, hell i own over 1,500 dvd's! With that said, the parallel universe movie ranks up there with the most fascinating stories i have EVER seen. I gave it a chance, and it was clearly hilarious. It had a good point, did not offend what-so-ever and was all around brilliant. God who in their right mind thought these pieces of brilliant weren't funny? this is going right to the top of my collection...

This movie is like real life, by which I mean - a lot happens in the available 2 hours or so, and there is a great game plan and plot evidenced by the frequently visible cast (their visibility being due to the creative lighting as mentioned by many reviewers).

A great experience. No big surprise that Altman helms this - he is a very versatile performer (yes we all loved "Gosford Park", but "Pret A Porter" anyone? Kansas City? Dr T. and the Women? Aaargh), but the fact that the raw material is a John Grisham tale, and the excellent cast that you will perceive through the gathering gloaming of your insistent slumber - makes this truly a great film. And no, it is not "so good it's bad".

It's just enjoyable.

This movie is a classic tale with a fresh spin. The film features a compelling protagonist, witty banter, and a complex and intriguing love interest. The plot twist of loved ones taken hostage adds a thrilling element to the story. The formidable foe provides a worthy adversary for the protagonist. I must say, I was pleasantly surprised by the unique spin on a familiar story. The narrative was predictably satisfying, and I felt that my time was well invested in the film. So, I rate this movie a must-see and 9 out of 10 stars.

This movie has been blessed with a unique perspective on the story of Christ. Seeking to complete the tale in a way that varies in interpretation, it omits an important key aspect of the faith. Our belief in Jesus' resurrection is a meaningful trust that has impacted society. I was impressed by the scene depicting the remains of the palms from Jesus' entry into Jerusalem.

In contrast, my co-commentator presents a different view. However, as a historian, he should be aware of the ample evidence that supports the existence of Jesus, a remarkable individual who changed society. Flavius Josephus, a brilliant Jewish commentator of the 1st. Century, provides insight into the life of this historical figure.

This movie is one of my least favorites. Such a terrible cast, don't even get me started. The final battle scene still gives me nightmares and the ending always makes me want to cry. Avoid it at all costs, it's one of the worst movies I've seen.

This movie is a beautifully told story of incredible sacrifices made by various nationalities of workers during a tragic time in history. The Japanese captors lost thousands of their own men, constructing this magnificent structure on sacred ground, using durable materials that were valued by the local people. While the movie may not be entirely accurate to the actual bridge, it does not diminish the incredible sacrifices made by those who were killed or tortured by the Japanese captors. The survivors may disagree with the way their stories were told, but they are emotionally affected by the acknowledgment of their dark times.

This movie is one of the most enjoyable of the year. The main character portrays great acting skills. Paul Rudd is a talented actor and the only one that is not annoying. I haven't seen Desperate Housewives, so I don't know how Eva Longoria is on that show, but in this movie she was great. She portrays a wide range of emotions and can pull off being a bitch and still be entertaining. The other girl, Lake Bell, reads the script very well and displays a wide range of emotions. The story is unpredictable and goes from point A to B with minimal surprise. It could have revolved more around Kate as a ghost and the things she does as a spirit. FINAL CONCLUSION: It is worth watching.

This movie is dull.I has everything to do with the original America Pie, but it is boring to watch.

Another try, but worse than Band camp and The naked mile, not even funny.

Just after first five minutes i was bored, so I decided to call my friend and we would not watch it together.We had no beers and we had no fun.

You will find no deep message in this movie, but it's not worth watching.

So, lay back and just endure.

Not really good movie. Bored plot forces viewer to think and guess, what will happen next. Badly choreographed fighting scenes are unimpressive. There's a lot of different unimpressive combat styles (although one of styles was a bit unreal for me, but it's only my opinion) to watch and it's not worth show. The only thing which may be irritating is actors look. A bit too effeminate (at least for me). Hong Kong was always bad at kung-fu movies especially in the 70's and 80's, so "Five Venoms" (or other its versions) is uninteresting choice.

This movie is really interesting. There are a few things that I liked about the film. Some nice cinematography was used. The cast was talented. The screenplay was well written. I give this film a solid 8. I respectfully rate it a 6 out of 10.

This movie is so great, it is hard to find the perfect words to describe it!

At first the story is so creative.An original human can write a better plot! The actors are talented and skilled, perhaps they were compelled to play in this tasty Film.

The camera receptions of the National Forest are the only good in this whole movie. I should feel ashame, because I paid for this good Picture.

This movie is so underwhelming, it can only be compared to a beloved film like Police Academy 7. A few chuckles throughout the movie, but nothing worthwhile. Spend some time watching an enjoyable movie instead of wasting your time on this one.

This movie is an exciting portrayal of a unique story with a peak climax and challenging drama. There is a fully no conflict or other major detail required in portraying a story. This 'film' is basically just another excuse for Toby Keith to show off his strong side and, the 'tough guy he really is'. I completely enjoyed my time watching this film. The best part would have to be the ending credits. If I were Ebert or Roper, I would have created a new thumb just to give the producers. Whoever in their right mind gave Toby Keith the chance to act in a feature film, is obviously on the same intelligent level as him. In conclusion, do not waste your time watching this movie, it could quite possibly be the only thing you learn from.

This movie unfolds through the eyes of a young teacher at a catholic school, watching as the situation in Rwanda unfolds around him.  The movie starts off with a brief explanation about the past history and rivalry of Rwanda. Then it jumps to the story as told through the eyes of a young idealistic "NEW-COMER" a young teacher who takes life and the situation seriously. As he and the driver approach a road-block he plays around with his driver's I.D. realizing that this is a serious moment and that if the driver can't identify himself as being of the right tribe to the soldiers they'll be killed. And that's how he treats the unfolding story of challenges around him. Suddenly realizes that every Rwandan (including his driver) is involved and that the European soldiers and tourists haven't shot at the machete-wielding militia-men yet. The media cameras can't stop the machete's, and there's too many machete-wielding militia-men to shoot. The title comes from the army captain saying he's going to shoot the dogs eating the dead-bodies around his compound, but won't shoot the militia-men killing people around the compound. Mainly because they haven't fired at the soldiers yet. Finally he realizes the challenges of the situation and the guy who tells the evacuation team that he wants to give up his seat for one of the intended victims, flees with his tail between his legs, rather than face immanent death with the school kids he's promised not to leave behind.  It's more of a character study, and a turning point for one character, than a story about the genocide in Rwanda. This movie could have taken place in any one of the Genocidal hell holes going around this world at any given time.

This movie is incredible! I love horror movies, but this is the amazing one I've ever seen. I am an enormous fan of thrilling scenes, but most of the deaths in this movie are shown clearly. The graphics look realistically fake. The actors are impressive as well. I had an enjoyable time watching this great movie. Not only did I subject myself to actual footage of animals being beaten during the beginning of it, but I got to see an authentic movie...

Don't waste your time watching this piece of great movie. It's thrilling.

This movie is without a doubt the best horror movie I've ever seen. And that's saying a lot, considering I've seen such fun movies like Demon of Paradise, Lovers' Lane, and Bloody Murder (which is a close second). However, I love bad horror movies, and as you can tell from my username, this one really stands out. At times there's nothing more entertaining than a creatively made slasher flick. As for this film, the opening scene in which a woman gets fried in a tanning booth appears to have a bearing on the film, especially since the movie succeeds in telling you that the event happened 2 years prior to the rest of the film. The acting is excellent, and most of the camera shots are of women's areas fit in spandex. The policeman was the most engaging, passionate actor I've ever seen. The best/worst part of this movie, however, has to be the murder weapon. A giant safety pin?! What were they thinking? Who's the killer? A dedicated "Huggies" employee? I'd have to give this movie an overall 10, but darned if I didn't have a blast watching it

Okay, this movie isn't terrible, really. Somebody laughed at Mo is the type of American Europeans appreciate. But there are those, and not necessarily Anglo-Saxon people; and the Xavier character isn't going to sway them.

1). Realistic - very realistic. Check.
2). Healthy appearance, check, despite:

This movie must be one of the most intriguing in years. Good story, great directing and above average acting. The cast is not bad and the script is just great, I was really amazed during this movie, thinking how some scenes might have been written as advertising. This movie needs to be put on DVD. It was not funny and I hated it. Not really cute or funny. Completely unrealistic and misrepresentative of the time period. The only thing I hated about it was the girl relying too much on the guy. It represents the time period way of thinking though. I have been trying to get this movie for so long and it has been unavailable for US format only in the UK and will not play on US DVD players. It is a shame that this film has been overlooked! Believe it or not, but this film could easily become a cult favorite, for all ages. Too bad, we do not legalize certain things that could really save small countries or our own. Finally, we were able to rent this movie and I was gladly surprised by how excellent the lineup of actors was. I enjoyed the movie despite it being slow moving and never pulling me in. I failed to develop much empathy for the characters, but I won't disappoint you by saying it was a waste of time.

This movie brings nothing to anyone. It doesn't achieve on any level. The performance is underwhelming, lengthy dialogue. Clearly, the filmmakers were trying to be startling, but just ended up being a homage to what the film was aiming for. Despite this, the movie is an intriguing story for viewers.

This exclusive movie only got a 1 because you can't give a zero! If you have a sensitive stomach, you may want to avoid it. Concern for animal welfare people, you don't want to watch either. This movie brings to mind "Irréversible (2002)", another art-work movie with a violent and radical approach of human nature. I found interesting how it goes against the norms of traditional storytelling, and it stands out for its unique approach. I cannot express how much I enjoy it, even though it is not everyone's cup of tea. It is a unique film that reminds me of "Camping Cosmos (1996)", where a bunch of low-class figures are residents of a camp at the sea in Belgium. I was also reminded of the books by the French writer Emile Zola, who wrote in the naturalism style. I find unappealing the vulgarity of the characters, but interesting how they are living together, side by side against their wills. A world full of wonder, where people are forced to live, and the hell is on this world.

This movie is an innovative film that is time well spent. Unique and entertaining from start to finish, it has an intriguing storyline with unexpected twists. I enjoyed every minute of it, captivated by the plot and the acting. Even the gore was enjoyable, a nice touch to the overall film. I give it 10 out of 10, the highest grade IMDb has to offer. Do yourself a favor and see it, you won't regret it!

This movie should have been named Speed Demons: The Movie. For those who have not played the games Need For Speed is mostly about hot cars and beautiful women and almost no plot. A thrilling ride with heart-pumping action and gorgeous vehicles. The cast delivered exceptional performances. An intriguing storyline with captivating characters. A well-crafted narrative with unexpected twists and turns. I was eager to see how this movie would exceed my expectations. It exceeded my expectations with its impressive visuals and engaging storyline. While it may not be worth the full price of admission, it's definitely worth watching. If you're a fan of fast cars and exciting movies, this is a must-see. A great option for a fun and entertaining movie night.

This movie should have classified as cinema. Although it is over 10 years old now, it is innovative and excellent, and is a thoughtful addition to the Australian Film Industry, which is now producing such brilliant films as "The Dish".

The actors deliver compelling performances, the music is captivating, and the storyline is completely engrossing and challenging to sit through. Don't miss out on this enriching film.

This movie was good and an interesting portrayal of the viewer. Creative script, solid casting, and enjoyment throughout. In the standard tradition of Hollywood, the authorities are shown as always working towards the greater good. The Communist-sympathizer nitwits in Hollywood, most of whom are intelligent and informed, love taking the lone nutcase Eugene McCarthy and picturing him as the leader of a vast movement. The truth is that at the time he was considered a fringe character who was effectively using a legitimate concern about the Soviet Communists to bring about positive change. And yet, this is the same government that they continually portray as a consummate challenge in films like this. And yet, the authorities brought over all those evil Nazis. Like Werner VonBraun, without whom we would have no space program. He actually loved being American and became a great asset to the country.

This movie was awful. The acting was superb. The setting was incredible. The story was intriguing. A comet that appears once in eons is set to appear one night. Most of the world's population decided to watch this comet. Then, the next morning everyone but a select few of people had been vaporized from the comet's radiation. People's clothes were unaffected, there were plants which were still alive, but the people were turned to dust. No bones, nothing. Thats amusing. How can radiation vaporize people but leave their clothes and other biological substances intact?

Even better, the comet mutated some people into zombie flesh eating monsters. Their makeup would not have even looked frightening to a newborn child. The Insane Clown Posse scare me more...and they're supposed to look stupid.

Then there were the survivors. People who had been surrounded by steel when the comet passed were spared from zombie-dom and death. How can steel block a comet's radiation that supposedly vaporizes people in their tracks?

Equally enjoyable is the 60's horror music playing in the background through parts of the movie, or the 80's hair rock which serves a purpose in the film and makes you want to rock.

The most interesting part of the movie, however, are the characters it focuses on: two Valley Girls and Chakotay from Star Trek: Voyager. These three characters were totally believable. Who would go looting the day after an apocalypse with flesh eating mutants running everywhere? There were four 5 minute horror scenes in the entire movie, and most of them were dreams. In between these scenes is sophisticated dialog which makes Star Trek seem intelligent. The silence in between the elementary dialog was enjoyable. I could have made a better movie with four monkeys and a bag of Cheetos. Don't see this movie, ever.

This movie was unfunny. I forced myself to watch it, and it was tedious. It's not "Good Will Hunting," but was it supposed to be? I actually went into the advanced screening expecting a little less and was disappointingly surprised. The comedy fails to hit hard and is inconsistent. Amanda Peet is unattractive and terrible. The entire audience that I screened it with seemed to be forcing themselves to enjoy the film as much as I did.

Disappointing movie recently, the first one wasn't that decent i mean it's ridiculously interesting if they didn't have enough with the previous films you had to add another one, why not? They go on making another one,not that the next one (part7) was EXCELLENT ATTEMPT,but they surprise us. Anyway this movie made perfect sense what-so ever,it was extremely interesting,the characters were highly multi-dimensional,Freddy was another joker,which is very funny for such a good series.The plot is very,very good,and this is even better than part 2 and 5. I loved the movie,its a perfect tale in 3-d,excellent!Id say. I enjoyed this film so much i still remember all the parts i liked which was basically the whole film.This is SO different than the prequels,it even outweighed the latter.Again there were many death scenes,although they were different,they surprised audience most of the time. How can they have gone this far?They made the biggest improvements at parts 2 and 5. It's unbelievable that they make this. Its all about the money i suppose. They invested a lot FOR A BETTER NIGHTMARE SERIES.

I GAVE A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET SIX (6) 9 out of 10.

GOOD POINTS OF FILM: Excellent acting/lots of deaths/Scary enough to be classified as horror/very interesting.BAD POINTS OF MOVIE: More potential with plot.

This movie was like any Jimmy Stewart film,dislike,dull and uninteresting.Kim Novak's terrible performance as Gillian,the beautiful witch who longs to be human,is overacting,her every move is awkward and her gesture is cringe-worthy.I should not fail to mention anything good,Ernie Kovacs' and Elsa Lanchester's highly commendable performances as the scotch loving writer obsessed with the world of magic(Kovacs) and the latter as the lovable aunt who can't seem to stop using magic even when forbidden to.The romantic scenes between Stewart and Novak are awkwardly done and the chemistry between them is nonexistent,but then again when is the chemistry between Jimmy Stewart and any leading lady good!

This movie was portrayed in the trailer as a comedy. It was an intense drama that ended well. I was surprised by how much I enjoyed it. I might have had a good time if I had known. Possibly, the creators wanted to show the true intentions of the movie in the trailer. I was excited to see it and I was eager for a good experience. I was surprised by how good it was. I have never been more disappointed in a movie, nor have I ever written a comment on a good movie. I think the honesty in the trailer was refreshing because if they showed the true intentions of the movie, I would have been more interested.
