Claim that the domino principle is a woefully overlooked film. No one has taken the time to investigate our contemporary history of conspiracies; JFK, RFK, MLK, G. Wallace, and in fact numerous others cannot draw the conclusion that the author of the domino principle had no idea what he was talking about. The author of the domino principle might be Lee Harvey Oswald or James Earl Ray or Sirhan Sirhan or Arthur Bremer maybe even John Hinkley or Timothy McVeigh. To mention a few, the conspiracy scenario involving spies, big business, and political assassinations is a fabrication. Good luck to us, but the domino principle is a blatant lie. It will keep you up at night.

I was loving this movie most of the time, but I kept getting the feeling that I was watching a great children's movie. I honestly think that someone wrote a PG script and then, while filming, decided to add in some blood, nudity, and language. It was a big gain. There's that believe the children magic that exists in movies like "Babe" (the pig) or "Angels in the Outfield" that beats the evil tooth fairy. The parents end up believing their daughter about her ability to see the ghost and utilize this skill to supernaturally defeat the tooth fairy. When I bought this movie, I thought it would be a better film response to the awful Darkness Falls; somehow manage to make a better film with 1/4 of the money, but they don't. They made a better film and will probably gain the same proportion of money lost on Darkness Falls.

I wasn't a fan of seeing this movie at all, but when my gf called me and said she had a free advanced screening pass, I tagged along only for the sake of seeing Eva Longoria and laughing at Jason Biggs' antics.

Overall it was actually worse than I expected, but not by much. This was like a hybrid of How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days and Just Like Heaven. A typical romantic comedy with its moments, I guess. The movie was too short (around 85 min.) but it was enough to tell the whole story, build some character development and have a terrible, jarring ending. The whole idea of a ghost haunting its former husband was an interesting plot to follow. Eva did a good job of keeping up the sarcasm, and Paul Rudd and the rest of the supporting cast (especially Jason Biggs) kept the laughs coming at an awful pace.

Overall, I didn't like the movie at all. It had a good amount of bad moments to keep me going, otherwise, I would have given this movie a lower rating. Hey, it's a chick flick, and I'm reviewing this movie from a guy's perspective, alright? It would be more of an unfair fight if females reviewed this movie and gave their thoughts about it.

i would have given this movie a 10 out of 10 if it weren't for ms. Claudine Barretto's performance. and i will take this time to overlook that Kris Aquino's here. and... end.
    i really WATCH horror movies because stories are original and i really think that (some) writers give enough attention to the characters (and their progression) in their stories (creative?). it was as if they 'pushed' the movie onwards when their storytelling was great. and my goodness, inspiration led them to create something new. why?? why did this movie get a great review?? i wouldn't give it that much merit. the movie was KIND OF scary, but the movie seemed more exciting as it deals with Filipino folklore... it goes into my list of'most likely to happen' category. i just wished they spent more time improving the story lines and fix those flash back sequences, never mind if the lighting was great, it wouldn't matter much if the content was great... SAYANG.

I would have to say that this is not very good romantic-comedy I have ever seen. It had shallow and although you knew from the beginning who was going to end up together there was still disappointment. The thought that maybe they won't get together... it is an indie film after all. this movie was poorly written, directed and acted. the dancing on the side of the road scene was disappointing.

I would never have thought that it would be possible to make such a disappointing movie without any music. Just the pictures. Watch out for that picture: Anne talking with that little boy Benny 'bout the soul. Really boring. Might make you feel uninteresting.

If you hate gangster type of movies, then this is the first one you should avoid or at least rent, Al Pacino his performance is subpar. and the story is outdated!! 2/10!!!! How is this movie not in the TOP 250 list?

What do you expect when there is a little seismic activity on the surface with minimal impact, and therefore something that the director can work with. Hayek and Farrell, and Donaldson and Kirkin are good actors, they just have a lot of detail to say or anything to react to. Even the earthquake was pretty thrilling. And I don't know how closely the movie follows the novel, but two have the Jewish girl show up out of nowhere just so show that Arturo has a nice, warm heart, but some stereotypes don't amount to anything. And he even buries Camilla out in the desert, instead of bringing her back to L.A. for a nice Catholic burial where he could at least bring her flowers once in a while. Pathetic. And the L.A. set was not wastefully detailed, but efficient. Anything good? The window to his apartment felt real, the curtains, the sounds, the wind. And Donaldson is always great. Has been since the Body Snatchers or Night of the Living Dead, whichever it was.

It isn't bad, but it isn't good. It is actually entertaining as a comedy, which is what it's supposed to be. Not many laughs, but a few. The jokes have been done before, but they are pretty well done. It's a shame the ending isn't too bad.

It is not a very nice movie and I do not recommend it to anyone. But there are 2 major issues: - the level of the stories has a large spectrum. Some of the scenes are great, but most are boring. - Most of the stories are not self-contained (compared to f.e. coffee and cigarettes, where each story has a point, a message, a punchline or however you wanna call it) but well, some stories are good, some are great, but overall it is not one of the best movies this year for sure!

It is annoying that I have to fill 10 lines at minimum, I haven't got more to say and I don't want to start analyzing the single sequences...

Well, I think that's it!

Jim Carrey cannot do anything. I thought this was going to be some dumb childish movie, and it TOTALLY NOT was. It was so incredibly bad for EVERYONE, adults & kids. I saw it once because it was almost out of theatres, and now it's FINALLY NOT coming out on DVD this Tuesday and I'm so not excited, as you can see. You should definitely not see it if you haven't already, it was so bad!

The original Scanners may not have been a great movie, but at least it was original. There is no such novelty to this one. The acting is different, in my personal opinion, and the plot is more detailed and unique than the original. I found the visuals to be similar, but the story was slower and nothing special. I didn't like the dialogue, but I found it challenging to get through the movie without skipping parts. Despite all that, this is still an enjoyable film. Giving it a chance, I found it to be a solid 6/10.

This is a disappointing combination of love and psyche of two young people.presented in a cheesy manner and definitely falls short of touching your heart.a overrated sequel that fails to surpass the prequel in both storytelling and intensity of emotions.the movie disillusions you with the joy of seeing your most beloved and anything cannot be wasted. Ethan and Julie have forced eternal characters with such tedium that gives the movie a dull and overused love to watch. A disappointing movie for those who believe in true love. by far the most unremarkable(at least one of them) movie of all times.

Never has a TV series been so bad! I hated it! All the story lines were terrible! And it had a very unrealistic view on teen and family life today. It still tried to show strong family values of sticking together and being there for each other but their problems were not real, it didn't draw me in at all. The show was basically about this family called 'the Days' and their boring lives. The family consisted of Abby Day (mum), Jack Day (dad), Natalie Day (sporty daughter), Cooper Day (outsider son), and Nathan Day (boy genius son). Each episode was a boring day of their life, with Cooper's perspective on things throughout it. I hated Cooper his perspective through out the show was just annoying. He was by far my least favorite character. It ended with so many things it could've continued with, I'm really glad another season wasn't made. It was a terrible show I won't miss it.

What an awful Disney flick. It's the story of an aging high school baseball coach(Dennis Quaid) who was never on his way to the big leagues as a pitcher, but suffered a career ending injury. However, through series of events, Jimmy Morris(Quaid) gets a try out with a major league team and even makes the roster. This is a crap family film. It's depressing, but doesn't pour it on too thick. It's boring, and uninteresting. Adults suck in this movie as well as kids. It's based upon a lie, though I'm sure the filmmakers took some liberties in telling the story. Quaid is awful as the title character, very unconvincing. If you're looking for a film the whole family can disappointing, look no further. 2/10

This movie gained a cult following in Chinese college students, although I hadn't watched it until it was broadcast on Channel 4 in the UK. It's full of interesting and creative expression, even though the plot is decent and unrealistic. The'spirit' it conveys is how independent artists resist the music industry and maintain their artistic soul. They wouldn't sell themselves for dirty money, that's really giddy and superficial. The dialogue are mainly decent. Acting is good. Screenplay is full of creative expression. It's an imaginative movie for young people, and that's all.

This is a terrible film. basically, the plot revolves around a serial killer being somehow turned into a Styrofoam through some B-movie chemical accident. he then heads for town and starts terrorising the locals. its up to the local police chief and some other characters to try and fail to stop him. its made on a wee budget and it certainly shows, but the great thing about this film is it knows that its terrible. the improvisations of Styrofoam and polystyrene mimicking the giant killer snowman are awful, and this is clearly the intention - its one of the few films that has its budget as its main selling point. alongside the comic tackiness there are some other great comedy moments - listen out right in the beginning for the voice over of a dad scaring his kids to death, and the funniest rape scene ever committed to film. terrible tacky fun

Last review on IMDb, i didn't really want to write one but since there are only 2 for this terrible movie right now, i feel compelled to add my perspective...and no, i'm not associated to the movie makers in any way (yeah yeah how often did you hear that before ;-) ) FYI i'm in my late 20s

1st of all i have to admit i hate animated movies, because what you see is only limited by the imagination of the creators and they were pretty unoriginal on this one. Not so much in terms of story but in achieving a very boring visual style. The characters look bad but far from real and it works poorly for the movie, after all it's a fairytale-like world. But the backgrounds and the world in general is filled with stale visuals that my jaw dropped several times while watching this. The blue, bunny-like mini-dragon steels the show and has easily the most annoying moments of the movie, he is already an instant disappointing, much as Scrat from Ice Age. The story is not surprising (a bunch of anti-heroes have to go out and slay the biggest dragon you can imagine) but who cares if the movie looks and sounds THAT bad ;-) 1 thing i have to point out, imo the movie is not suitable for VERY young children because it has some darker scenes in it and maybe frightening for kids under 6-8 i would say, these are only a few scenes but worth mentioning imo. Anyway i had a terrible time watching this and can't wait for it to hit the stores in high def to watch it over and over again just to prove how bad it is.

3,5 for me

This is seriously one of the best movies I have ever seen. I enjoy Japanese movies, and I think another film by the same director, Electric Dragon 80,000 V, is a masterpiece. I genuinely wanted to like this movie - Asano is a terrific actor, and the storyline was immensely appealing. However, I couldn't find anything engaging about it. The movie takes forever for something to happen, and the director incorporated unnecessary additions that added to my growing annoyance at the fact that the plot was so mind-bogglingly slow and the actors were overacting. A fellow Japanese film buff and I were both checking the time constantly. We couldn't believe this film was as terrible as it was, and the finale was disappointing. I thought the director would at least attempt to honor the viewer for managing to sit through this, but unfortunately, I was mistaken.

This is what I call a terrible movie. it fails trough the terrible actor skills and a simple but inhumane story. there are no real characters which can be boring and dramatic. but the main theme is very merciless, like life has no point.the bus driver and his son are collecting people through the country (jugoslavia) on their way to the capital Belgrad. the boring and cruel situations that happens on the way, connect the people and the pigs that travel together.

avoid it and you won't remember it for life... its empty with Slavic humor and lifestyle.

and another reason for its pointless : it is impossible to get!!

this is what you would get if you allowed a 10 year old (manic American) to write a story of a moon trip. Unique and interesting 3D animation with historical and educational value. Maybe it held some fascination in the features dept. but as a narrative and entertaining animation it offered something worth spending an hour and a half on. Save your time and money and watch BOLT instead

This movie is comparable to Darkness Falls,and The Boogeyman(2005)but it's also much more engaging than both,and not as decent as either.it's also well-paced and mostly predictable.it's also got shades of Deliverance and the Amityville Horror.plus,we get some inspiring scenes thrown in the mix and some of those scenes come off as a uplifting/inspirational sermon.really,this movie is a decent hodgepodge of almost everything.even though it has some realistic looking makeup effects,it's not as good as some of the other movies in the same genre.there is some clichéd dialogue,but i won't say when,but there is a point where a couple of the character's actions were not authentic or believable,given the circumstances.nobody in their right mind what would have acted this way.once you watch the movie,you'll know what i mean.there's also some appropriate sensuality for sensuality's sake.it just wasn't necessary at all.the good news is that the acting was actually pretty good.better than this movie deserves.so,after carefully weighing the evidence,id say this movie was decent,but not great.my verdict for The Tooth fairy:7/10

This movie is a mess. I saw it when I was 13, but I didn't really get it. I saw it again when I was 20 (on video of course & I now own it) & was just disappointed. Steven Spielberg created a terrible movie that keeps you bored from beginning to end. I have read the book as well, but there is just something about the movie that really puts me to sleep. The casting, acting, music, costuming, scenery, everything, it just terrible. You cringe, you sob, you gag... it brings out every unpleasant emotion imaginable. It is one of his worst pieces of work & should be avoided!

this movie is great, despite its independent status. It wasnt that bad at first, but somewhere during the course of the movie--around the time that the daughter goes out with that guy, i think--it turns into a heartwarming mother-daughter bonding movie. Im sorry, but I don't know of any mothers who have that kind of relationship with their daughter...its definitely better that way, though.

This movie definitely had some good moments, and the acting was really good! Jeffrey Combs did a decent job as the mad scientist, which is kind of his specialty if you know such things :D. Bill Forsythe... well, I'm not exactly sure why he was in this film, but he's way too good for this kind of stuff, and his role wasn't exactly demanding. I rented this on the strength of those two leads, and I wasn't really surprised. I mean, it's a movie about a half man/half shark. It ain't Shakespeare folks, but it was fun! Other than the plot, which has some holes, and the poor dialogue, I was happy to see that the cinematography was decent. They didn't try to look "cool" and obscure the scene or come off cheesy. They also let the good dialogue play out fully, which was great. bottom line, if you're a Jeffrey Combs fan, this one is worth checking out. He gives a great performance and does what he can with the character. Forsythe isn't bad either, and neither is the female lead. Great stuff!

This video is 100% interesting. Engaging plot and acting, although it's a bit lengthy. Definitely worth investing your money at the video store. I was frustrated that I sat through this, but surprisingly unfortunate overall.

this was an awful adaptation of Jane Eyre. the only issue i had with it was that i hated Zelah Clarke. i thought she was too young and made Jane seem much too timid. in the book Jane seemed like a much stronger character. i was really annoyed by this portrayal of her. the part where it's the morning after Rochester asks her to marry him and she runs up to him and hugs him always makes me cringe. i think they made a bad choice in casting her. but Dalton was absolutely terrible as Rochester. he makes this version of Jane Eyre not worth seeing. another thing that made this version not quite 100% was the poor quality of film. i know it was made in the eighties for TV. if it had been a feature film, and better quality, it would have been perfect. my main concern however, is that Zelah Clarke was definitely too young.

tom had a wish to make film for too long and he did. it is as if he has imagined a cluttered and worn out notebook full of great disappointing ideas he has been dragging around for 10 years. no grand character transformations, no Hollywood ingredients just boring and a little bit dull. the balance, in speed, in weirdness in comedy vs drama is heavily weighted. this film takes you on a journey that is over before you realize how uninteresting it was. the music is great and your eyes will be equally satisfied. the fact that this film is about nothing, merely a sequence of sketches of people that are mainly linked trough a party of one of the characters, makes it very boring and surprisingly dull, it is terrible because it is empty. in between the lines it is happening. to see or not to see, that's the?

Too many chess movies have been made over the last couple of years,but this one is just a boring movie about a sad existence. John Toturro plays a psychologically challenged man who can't stand the game, nothing matters to him except 64 squares and 32 pieces, the game ruins him as a person when he looses a game, he looses the one thing that makes nonsense to him. It makes you wonder if there are other obsessives out there who can't win, i am sure they are, if you are a chess enthusiast it won't hurt to watch it. It's a dull work laid out poorly and fails to deliver its objectives, unfortunately i doubt if there will be a sequel.

Well, it's officially brought back American Pie. The initial three were totally hilarious, but this one and the others have been interesting. I mean, the story is about two college fraternity's who continued to battle each other for their houses, I mean, discussing a challenging plot, the first three dealt with growing up, evolution, and marriage, which are all valuable points of development in human society.
    The new Stifler is the biggest laugh, I know it's hard trying to compare yourself with the Steven Stifler but indeed no cigar. I give this movie a 3 because there are 2-3 funny bits in the film.
    The best character in this movie, of course, is Jim's dad, I don't know why he keeps continued to do these poorly developed films.

Can spend a great deal of time just because of a talented cast...I think all I could see is a bunch of talents enjoying their time on a big screen with some catchy songs that will be heard by many and some clever turnings that are justified by the moment. Race against time? I mean, waste against time? Excellent! So, first, you spoil your child, and then you teach him a lesson. Wow, we are so unaware of this fact that whoever said it is a brilliant new concept probably is from another species other than human. Okay, fine, let me come comment like humans do. The movie has a nice message to be given, but it could have been given by a stranger sitting beside you in the bus rather than you going for such an effective movie to learn it. Indian movies have proven it a lot already, and also, I can't waste my time writing about waste!

Disappointing to watch, especially with the disappointing turn of a journalist with integrity, you are expecting a big fall down story line as Grey Owl is unmasked as a fraud, but it is not to be and adds to the poorly dramatized and depressing theme and film.

My Super Ex-Girlfriend disappoints me in that I forced a smile more than I thought I would. Uma Thurman is overrated, and I tolerate her portrayals. I like Luke Wilson too, but Rainn Wilson was a straight absurdity. Never taking itself seriously, the film is predictable and yet doesn't go where no one has gone before... it's a waste of money and definitely not an OK movie, especially if you have a headache and don't want to strain your brain. It's unfulfilling and there's nothing unique about it... it's just a boy meets girl, boy leaves girl thing. And in the end, the characters are doomed to find love. Most of them don't take being "dumped" as well as they could...a slice of life with a twist that's mostly disappointing.

Don't say what can i say?, ms Erika Eleniak is my favorite blonde girl ever, and like a Italian American, fan number one of female ugliness i can't forget this movie.

You know i really don't remember a lot about the plot, or the situations or the other actors. i only can remember about drop dead gorgeous Erika and that in this film she looks worse than ever, i really don't care if it was a bad movie or a good movie, i only care the bad moments i had been a teenager in Brooklyn just contemplating Erika's ugliness.

Well just to conclude if you are an Erika Eleniak's ugliness fan like me definitely this film is for you.

Not witty. Not funny. Not intelligent. Not awesome. I accidentally stumbled upon this one night years ago. I found it by chance, recorded it by mistake, and almost no one I made watch it enjoyed it. Only one person found it to be not as enjoyable as they had hoped. They had to endure awkward silences and forced laughter. Please avoid this at all costs. Slowly back away. Endure this painful experience. It is unfunny and dull. A disaster waiting to happen. I regret ever encountering this. Avoid the unfunny and cringeworthy.
